info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 6:06PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Wayne County through 700 PM EDT... At 605 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Southfield, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, pea size hail, and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Dearborn around 640 PM EDT. Detroit around 650 PM EDT. Downtown Detroit and Belle Isle around 700 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Northeast Detroit, Highland Park, Northwest Detroit, Harper Woods, Grosse Pointe Shores, Redford, Southwest Detroit, Hamtramck, Grosse Pointe Woods and Grosse Pointe Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
